com.github.kaktushose.jda.commands.annotations

Annotation Type Optional


  • @Target(value=PARAMETER)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface Optional
    Parameters annotated with Optional are as the name says optional.

    More formally if a command has an optional parameter the argument doesn't need to be present to execute the command. An optional parameter can also be followed by another optional parameter, but not by a non-optional parameter.

    It is also possible to pass a default value which will be used instead if the argument isn't present. The default value will be handled as a normal input and thus the ArgumentParser will try to parse it. If the parsing fails the command will still be executed but with empty or possible null values.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Kaktushose
    See Also:
    Command
